unnormalised: The Income Tax Department has extended the deadline for filing ITR for AY 2024-25 to 31/07/2024. This extension comes after numerous requests from taxpayers and tax professionals citing technical glitches on the e-filing portal. The original deadline was set for 30/06/2024.
normalised: The Income Tax Department has extended the deadline for filing I-T-R for A-Y two thousand twenty four two thousand twenty five to thirty first july two thousand twenty four. This extension comes after numerous requests from taxpayers and tax professionals citing technical glitches on the e-filing portal. The original deadline was set for thirtieth june two thousand twenty four.

unnormalised: According to a press release issued by the Ministry of Finance, the decision aims to ease the compliance burden on individual taxpayers and businesses alike. Failure to file returns by the revised deadline will attract penalties under Section 234F of the Income Tax Act, potentially amounting to Rs. 5000 for those with income exceeding Rs. 5 lakh, and Rs. 1000 for lower-income groups. Chartered Accountants across India, including CA R.K. Gupta in Delhi, have lauded the move.

unnormalised: Experts are advising taxpayers to gather all necessary documents, including Form 16, Form 26AS, and investment proofs, before commencing the filing process.
